attr_labels.signature: Digital Signature - base64 encoded. XML-DSig or a JWT.
attr_labels.entry.search: Information about the search process that lead to the creation of this entry.
attr_labels.link: A series of links that provide context to this bundle.
attr_labels.entry.link.relation: A name which details the functional use for this link - see [http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml#link-relations-1](http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml#link-relations-1).
attr_labels.entry.search.mode: Why this entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.
attr_labels.type: Indicates the purpose of this bundle - how it is intended to be used.
attr_labels.entry.response.outcome: An OperationOutcome containing hints and warnings produced as part of processing this entry in a batch or transaction.
attr_labels.entry.response.status: The status code returned by processing this entry. The status SHALL start with a 3 digit HTTP code (e.g. 404) and may contain the standard HTTP description associated with the status code.
attr_labels.total: If a set of search matches, this is the total number of entries of type 'match' across all pages in the search.  It does not include search.mode = 'include' or 'outcome' entries and it does not provide a count of the number of entries in the Bundle.
attr_labels.entry.link: A series of links that provide context to this entry.
attr_labels.entry.fullUrl:
The Absolute URL for the resource.  The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except that: 
* fullUrl can be empty on a POST (although it does not need to when specifying a temporary id for reference in the bundle)
* Results from operations might involve resources that are not identified.
attr_labels.entry.resource: The Resource for the entry. The purpose/meaning of the resource is determined by the Bundle.type.
attr_labels.entry.request.ifNoneMatch: If the ETag values match, return a 304 Not Modified status. See the API documentation for [\Conditional Read\](http.html#cread).
attr_labels.timestamp: The date/time that the bundle was assembled - i.e. when the resources were placed in the bundle.
attr_labels.entry.response: Indicates the results of processing the corresponding 'request' entry in the batch or transaction being responded to or what the results of an operation where when returning history.
attr_labels.entry.response.location: The location header created by processing this operation, populated if the operation returns a location.
attr_labels.identifier: A persistent identifier for the bundle that won't change as a bundle is copied from server to server.
attr_labels.entry.request.url: The URL for this entry, relative to the root (the address to which the request is posted).
attr_labels.entry.response.lastModified: The date/time that the resource was modified on the server.
attr_labels.entry.search.score: When searching, the server's search ranking score for the entry.
attr_labels.link.url: The reference details for the link.
attr_labels.entry.request: Additional information about how this entry should be processed as part of a transaction or batch.  For history, it shows how the entry was processed to create the version contained in the entry.
attr_labels.link.relation: A name which details the functional use for this link - see [http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml#link-relations-1](http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml#link-relations-1).
attr_labels.entry.request.method: In a transaction or batch, this is the HTTP action to be executed for this entry. In a history bundle, this indicates the HTTP action that occurred.
attr_labels.entry.request.ifModifiedSince: Only perform the operation if the last updated date matches. See the API documentation for [\Conditional Read\](http.html#cread).
attr_labels.entry.request.ifNoneExist: Instruct the server not to perform the create if a specified resource already exists. For further information, see the API documentation for [\Conditional Create\](http.html#ccreate). This is just the query portion of the URL - what follows the \?\ (not including the \?\).
attr_labels.entry.request.ifMatch: Only perform the operation if the Etag value matches. For more information, see the API section [\Managing Resource Contention\](http.html#concurrency).
attr_labels.entry: An entry in a bundle resource - will either contain a resource or information about a resource (transactions and history only).
attr_labels.entry.link.url: The reference details for the link.
attr_labels.entry.response.etag: The Etag for the resource, if the operation for the entry produced a versioned resource (see [Resource Metadata and Versioning](http.html#versioning) and [Managing Resource Contention](http.html#concurrency)).
